sentences.sContent: A criminal record will prejudice your chances of getting a job.
sentences.sCn: 犯罪记录会不利于你就业。

sentences.sContent: He refused to comment, saying he did not wish to prejudice the outcome of the talks.
sentences.sCn: 他拒绝发表评论，称不希望影响会谈结果。

remMethod.val: pre(预先)＋jud(判断)＋ice→先入为主的判断， 容易产生偏见→偏见， 成见

words.tran: 怀偏见的；有成见的；偏颇的
不利的；有害的；引起偏见的
损害（prejudice的过去分词）；使抱偏见

trans.tranCn: 使抱偏见； 影响；损害
trans.tranOther: to have a bad effect on the future success or situation of someone or something

trans.tranCn: 偏见， 成见；损害， 侵害
trans.tranOther: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
